items.title: 20 custodial deaths in two years in Rajasthan; rights groups express concern
items.summary: Civil rights groups in the State have expressed concern over the custodial deaths and demanded judicial inquiry into each of them and transparent investigation into the cases classified as suicides or medical causes, in order to ensure accountability.

items.title: Morning Digest: Former Chief Justice Sushila Karki is Nepal’s first woman Prime Minister; Imphal, Churachandpur decked up to greet PM Modi on first visit since ethnic conflict erupted, and more

items.title: India votes in favour of UNGA resolution on Palestine endorsing two-state solution
items.summary: The resolution, introduced by France, was adopted with an overwhelming 142 nations voting in favour, 10 against and 12 abstentions

items.title: Discussion on strengthening child protection mechanisms held
After the disaster: Punjab flood victims face displacement and livelihood loss
items.summary: Punjab’s floods have taken 55 lives and left thousands of people homeless. Vikas Vasudeva reports on the anxiety around the loss of farm produce and jobs. People in relief camps wonder when they can return home and worry about the condition of their houses and belongings collected over years of work

items.summary: They discussed a wide range of possible economic measures to increase pressure on Russia

items.title: South Central Railway, State departments to coordinate on crowd control measures

items.title: Ending India’s Russian oil imports is top priority, says U.S. envoy-designate Sergio Gor

items.summary: For the first time, Chennai is constructing an elevated four-lane corridor directly above underground Metro tunnels between Teynampet and Saidapet, ensuring the twin tunnels remain completely safe.

items.title: Motorist dies after SUV laden with red sanders hits him
items.summary: Police searched the vehicle and found 15 wooden logs of red sanders that weighed over 500 kg and worth around ₹ 20 lakh.

items.summary: Police said the gang went to the outlet and allegedly demanded snacks, tea and coffee free of cost.

items.title: Watch: Ground report: Manipur prepares for PM Modi’s visit amid ethnic crisis
items.summary: The visit comes over two years after deadly ethnic violence between Kuki and Meitei communities left over 260 dead and thousands homeless. The Hindu Deputy Editor Vijaita Singh reports on the ongoing situation and the political context surrounding Modi’s visit.
